Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.name: isEmpty
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.abstract: Returns true, if yes, we have no bananas.

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.name: count
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html#/s:1.abstract: The number of elements we have. 1-based. 0 is no elements (isEmpty is true).

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: owner
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This refers to the device instance that “owns” this service.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: properties
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This is the public read-only access to the properties list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: uuid
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This is the read-only unique ID for this service.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: count
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This is the read-only count of properties.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: subscript(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: This is a public read-only subscript to the property list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: isThisInstanceASubscriber(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: Test to see if a subscriber is already subscribed.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.name: unsubscribe(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceProtocol.h.abstract: remove a subscriber from the list. Nothing happens if the subscriber is not already subscribed.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.name: service(_:propertyAdded:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.abstract: OPTIONAL: Called When a property is added to the main list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.name: serviceStatusUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.abstract: OPTIONAL: Called to indicate that the service’s status should be checked.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.name: propertyStatusUpdate(_:property:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_ServiceSubscriber.abstract: OPTIONAL: Called to indicate that a property’s status should be checked.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: owner
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: This is a read-only accessor for the object that “owns” this instance.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: rawValue
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: The value, expressed as raw Data. Nil, if no value available (or not available as Data).

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: value
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: The Value, but cast into a specific data type (selected by the enum).

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: description
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: The user description of the value (if any). If none, the String will be empty.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: uuid
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: The UUID of the value characteristic, as a String.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: canBroadcast
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: True, if the characteristic can broadcast its value.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: canRead
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: True, if the characteristic can be read.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: canWrite
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: True, if the characteristic can be written, with or without a response.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: canWriteWithResponse
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: True, if the characteristic can be written, with a response.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: canWriteWithoutResponse
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: True, if the characteristic can be written, without a response.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: canNotify
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: True, if the characteristic can notify.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: canIndicate
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: True, if the characteristic can indicate. The driver need sto respond to indications.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: canHaveAuthenticatedSignedWrites
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: True, if the characteristic can have authenticated signed writes, without a response.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: isEncryptionRequiredForNotify
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: Only trusted devices can subscribe to notifications of this property.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: isEncryptionRequiredForIndication
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: REQUIRED: Only trusted devices can see indications of this property.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_ELM327_Device.name: elm327Version
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_ELM327_Device.abstract: This returns the ELM327 chipset version for the device.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceProtoco.name: delegate
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceProtoco.abstract: This will be a weak reference to the instance delegate.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceProtoco.name: readProperty
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceProtoco.abstract: This property is one that the OBD unit uses to return responses to the driver.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceProtoco.name: writeProperty
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceProtoco.abstract: This property is one that the driver uses to send commands to the OBD unit.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceProtoco.name: sendCommandWithResponse(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceProtoco.abstract: This menthod will send an AT command to the OBD unit. Responses will arrive in the readProperty.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceDelegat.name: device(_:returnedThisData:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceDelegat.abstract: REQUIRED: This is called when an OBD device responds with data.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.name: btDriver(_:encounteredThisError:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.abstract: Error reporting method. This is required for the delegate.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.name: btDriver(_:newDeviceAdded:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.abstract: Called when a device has been added and instantiated.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.name: btDriverStatusUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.abstract: Called to indicate that the driver’s status should be checked.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.name: btDriverScanningChanged(_:isScanning:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html#/s:1.abstract: Called to indicate that the driver started or stopped scanning.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.name: _uuid
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.abstract: REQUIRED: The implementation is required to provide this. The implementation should not do anything with it; simply provide a read/write instance property.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.name: uuid
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.abstract: This is a unique UUID that needs to be assigned to each instance, so we can match subscribers.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: owner
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This refers to the driver instance that “owns” this device.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: uuid
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is a String, containing a unique ID for this peripheral.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: deviceName
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: A name for the device (may be the model name, may be something else).

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: modelName
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a model name, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: manufacturerName
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a manufacturer name, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: serialNumber
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a manufacturer name, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: hardwareRevision
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a hardware revision, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: firmwareRevision
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a firmware revision, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: softwareRevision
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: If the device has a Device Info Service with a software revision, it is available here.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: services
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is the public read-only access to the service list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: isConnected
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is the public flag, determining whether or not the device is connected.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: canConnect
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is the public flag, displaying whether or not the device can be connected.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: count
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is the read-only count of services.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: deviceType
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is the device type. Default is .unTested

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: subscript(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: This is a public read-only subscript to the service list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: isThisInstanceASubscriber(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: Test to see if a subscriber is already subscribed.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.name: unsubscribe(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol.ht.abstract: remove a subscriber from the list. Nothing happens if the subscriber is not already subscribed.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.name: device(_:serviceAdded:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.abstract: OPTIONAL: Called When a service is added to the main list.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.name: deviceStatusUpdate(_:)
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.abstract: OPTIONAL: Called to indicate that the device’s status should be checked.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.name: RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceSubscriberP.abstract: This is a protocol for classes, structs or enums that want to “subscribe” to a device.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.name: RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_SubscriberProtoco.abstract: This is a “base” subscriber protocol for accessing driver elements.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html.name: RVS_BTDriverDelegate
Protocols/RVS_BTDriverDelegate.html.abstract: This is the delegate for the driver instance. You should definitely do this.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceDelegat.name: RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceDelegate
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_DeviceDelegat.abstract: This protocol is for delegates for OBD devices.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_ELM327_Device.name: RVS_BTDriver_OBD_ELM327_DeviceProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_ELM327_Device.abstract: This is a specialization for the common ELM327 chipset.

Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..name: RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol
Protocols/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol..abstract: This represents the public face of a “property,” which maps to a bluetooth “characteristic.”

Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.name: RVS_SequenceProtocol
Protocols/RVS_SequenceProtocol.html.abstract: If you conform to this protocol, you get a few basic Sequence attributes for free.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: stringValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data, cast to a String (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: intValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data, cast to an Integer (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: boolValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data, cast to a Boolean (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: floatValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data, cast to a double-precision float (associated value)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: rawValue(_:)
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: The data is not able to be cast, and is returned as the raw Data type.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: undefinedValue
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: This is returned if the data is nil, or an undefined type (no associated value).

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: getDeviceDescription
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: This applies to the “General” group of commands.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setDeviceIdentifier
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the device ID (Character String -Up to 12 ASCII Characters)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setBaudRateDivisor
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Baud Rate Divisor (Up to 2 hex digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setBaudRateHandshakeTimeout
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Baud Rate Rate Handshake Timeout (Up to 2 hex digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: restoreToDefaults
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Restore the OBD Device to Defaults (no parameters)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: storeData
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Store 1 Byte of Data in Memory (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: useLongMessages
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: This applies to the “OBD” group of commands.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: describeProtocolByNumber
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Describe the Current Protocol as a Number (no parameters)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setMonitorForReceiver
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Monitor for Receiver (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setMonitorForTransmitter
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Monitor for Transmitter (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setReceiveAddress
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Receive Address (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setReceiveAddress2
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Receive Address (Alternate Command -Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setTimeOutBy4MillisecondIntervals
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set Timeout to Multiples of 4ms (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: turnCANAutoFormattingOn
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: This applies to the “CAN” group of commands.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setCANExtendedAddressing
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Turn on CAN Extended Addressing, and Set it to the Given Value (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setIDFilter1
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the ID Filter (3 Hex Digits -1, and 2)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setIDFilter2
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the ID Filter (4 Groups of 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setFlowControlData
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the CAN Flow Control Data (Up to 5 Hex Bytes -10 Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setFlowControlHeader
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the CAN Flow Control Header (4 Groups of 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setFlowControlMode
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the CAN Flow Control Mode (1 Hex Digit)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setProtocolBOptionsAndBaudRate
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Protocol B Options and Baud Rate (2 Groups of 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setCalibratingVoltage
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: This applies to the “Volts” group of commands.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: monitorForDM1Messages
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: This applies to the “J1939” group of commands.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setPGNMonitor1
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the PGN Monitor (Up to 4 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setPGNMonitor2
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the PGN Monitor (Up to six Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setPGNMonitorGetMessages
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the PGN Monitor (Up to 4 Hex Digits, and 1 Hex Digit)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setIFRValueFromHeader
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: This applies to the “J1850” group of commands.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setIFRValueFromSource
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: The IFR Value Should be Set From the Source (no parameters)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: useIFRsAuto
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Turn On IFRs, and Set to Auto (no parameters)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: isoBaudRate10400
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: This applies to the “ISO” group of commands.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: isoBaudRate4800
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Try to Set Baud Rate to 4800 (no parameters)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: isoBaudRate9600
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Try to Set Baud Rate to 9600 (no parameters)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setISOInitAddress
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the ISO Initial Address (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setWakeupIntervalMultiplerBy20ms
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Wakeup Interval to Multiple of 4ms (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setWakeupMessage
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Wakeup Message (Up to 6 Bytes -12 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: turnAllPPsProgParametersOn
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: This applies to the “PPs” group of commands.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setPPsProgParameterOn
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Turn On the Given Program Parameter (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setPPsProgParameterOff
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Turn On the Given Program Parameter (Up to 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: setPPsProgParameterValue
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: Set the Given Program Parameter to the Given Value (2 Sets of 2 Hex Digits)

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_OBD_Types.html.name: unknown
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_OBD_Types.html.abstract: The adapter is not a known type.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_OBD_Types.html.name: RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_OBD_Types
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_Vendor_OBD_Types.html.abstract: This is a wrapper for further exploration of the OBD type.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceType.html.name: RVS_BTDriver_DeviceType
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_DeviceType.html.abstract: This enum is used to help identify what the device is.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.name: RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_General
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_OBD_Command_String_Ge.abstract: This enum is used to define OBD Commands As Strings.

Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.name: RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type_Enum
Enums/RVS_BTDriver_PropertyProtocol_Type.abstract: This enum is used to cast a property value into its proper data type.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: bluetoothNotAvailable
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: This is returned if the manager can’t power on.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: connectionAttemptFailed(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: This is returned if we cannot connect to the device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: connectionAttemptFailedNoDevice
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: This is returned if we connected, but no device was available. This should never happen.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: disconnectionAttemptFailed(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: This is returned if we cannot disconnect from the device.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: unknownDisconnectionError
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: This is a “catchall” error for a disconnection issue

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: unknownPeripheralDiscoveryError(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: This is a “catchall” error for peripheral discovery

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: characteristicValueMissing
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: This means that we did not get a characteristic value

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: unknownCharacteristicsDiscoveryError(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: This is a “catchall” error for characteristics discovery

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: unknownCharacteristicsReadValueError(error:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: This is a “catchall” error for characteristics value read

Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.name: localizedDescription
Classes/RVS_BTDriver/Errors.html#/s:18RV.abstract: The localized description is a simple slug that can be used to key a client-supplied message.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.name: sequence_contents
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.abstract: This is a public read-only list of devices, masked by the protocol.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.name: subscript(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.abstract: Simple “String Key” subscript, so we can treat the array as a dictionary.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.name: delegate
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.abstract: A weak reference to the instance delegate.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.name: startScanning()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.abstract: Tells the vendor interfaces (all of them) to start scanning for services.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.name: stopScanning()
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.abstract: Tells the vendor interfaces to stop scanning.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.name: removeDevice(_:)
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/s:18RVS_BTDri.abstract: Removes an indicated device from our list.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BTD.name: description
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html#/c:@CM@RVS_BTD.abstract: This is a simplified, readable description of the instance that should be quite useful.

Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html.name: RVS_BTDriver
Classes/RVS_BTDriver.html.abstract: This is the main driver class. It is the “manager” for all the bluetooth-connected devices, which are accessible as RVS_BTDriver_DeviceProtocol-conformant instances.
